body:
@juhanishen it sounds like MLflow was pip-installed outside of your conda environment (the `mlflow` executable is in `/usr/local/python3Dir` rather than under a directory managed by conda). Thus `mlflow` is available on your path but is not installed within your conda environment, so `python` (an executable within your conda environment) is unable to find it. I'd try removing the MLflow installation outside your conda environment & reinstalling it within your environment, such that the parent directories of `python` and `mlflow` are the same. For example, my environment looks like:

```
(mlflow_python3) ➜  mlflow git:(branch-0.9) which python
/Users/siddharthmurching/miniconda3/envs/mlflow_python3/bin/python
(mlflow_python3) ➜  mlflow git:(branch-0.9) which mlflow
/Users/siddharthmurching/miniconda3/envs/mlflow_python3/bin/mlflow
```

I try to uninstall mlflow, but I could not delete mlflow, see the steps below:

```
(base) [k8s@k8s ~]$ pip uninstall mlflow
Skipping mlflow as it is not installed.
(base) [k8s@k8s ~]$ whereis mlflow
mlflow: /usr/local/python3Dir/bin/mlflow
(base) [k8s@k8s ~]$ which mlflow
/usr/local/python3Dir/bin/mlflow
```
At the same time, I found I have multiple python 3 installed. 

```
(base) [k8s@k8s ~]$ which mlflow
/usr/local/python3Dir/bin/mlflow
(base) [k8s@k8s ~]$ which python
~/anaconda3/bin/python
(base) [k8s@k8s ~]$ which python2.7
/usr/bin/python2.7
(base) [k8s@k8s ~]$ which python3.7
~/anaconda3/bin/python3.7
(base) [k8s@k8s ~]$ whereis python
python: /usr/bin/python /usr/bin/python2.7 /usr/bin/python.bak /usr/lib/python2.7 /usr/lib64/python2.7 /etc/python /usr/include/python2.7 /home/k8s/anaconda3/bin/python /home/k8s/anaconda3/bin/python3.7-config /home/k8s/anaconda3/bin/python3.7m /home/k8s/anaconda3/bin/python3.7 /home/k8s/anaconda3/bin/python3.7m-config /usr/local/python3Dir/bin/python3.7m /usr/local/python3Dir/bin/python3.7 /usr/local/python3Dir/bin/python3.7m-config /usr/local/python3Dir/bin/python3.7-config /usr/share/man/man1/python.1.gz

```
My question is how to uninstall mlflow and install mlflow in the conda environment?

Edited:
Now I just enter directory  ~/anaconda3/bin, then pip install mlflow, now I could compile and run example:

```
(base) [k8s@k8s mlflow]$ python examples/sklearn_elasticnet_wine/train.py
/home/k8s/anaconda3/lib/python3.7/site-packages/mlflow/utils/environment.py:26: YAMLLoadWarning: calling yaml.load() without Loader=... is deprecated, as the default Loader is unsafe. Please read https://msg.pyyaml.org/load for full details.
  env = yaml.load(_conda_header)
Elasticnet model (alpha=0.500000, l1_ratio=0.500000):
  RMSE: 0.8222428497595401
  MAE: 0.6278761410160693
  R2: 0.12678721972772666
(base) [k8s@k8s mlflow]$
```
Now mlflow is in conda env:
```
(base) [k8s@k8s mlflow]$ which mlflow
~/anaconda3/bin/mlflow
```

I am  having trouble to run the command  mlflow ui  though mlrun file  has been created with logged param and metrics for evaluation
``
[2020-03-04 13:39:54 +0545] [11791] [INFO] Starting gunicorn 20.0.4
[2020-03-04 13:39:54 +0545] [11791] [INFO] Listening at: http://127.0.0.1:5000 (11791)
[2020-03-04 13:39:54 +0545] [11791] [INFO] Using worker: sync
[2020-03-04 13:39:54 +0545] [11794] [INFO] Booting worker with pid: 11794
[2020-03-04 13:39:54 +0545] [11794] [ERROR] Exception in worker process
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "/home/anish/.local/lib/python3.6/site-packages/gunicorn/arbiter.py", line 583, in spawn_worker
    worker.init_process()
  File "/home/anish/.local/lib/python3.6/site-packages/gunicorn/workers/base.py", line 119, in init_process
    self.load_wsgi()
  File "/home/anish/.local/lib/python3.6/site-packages/gunicorn/workers/base.py", line 144, in load_wsgi
    self.wsgi = self.app.wsgi()
  File "/home/anish/.local/lib/python3.6/site-packages/gunicorn/app/base.py", line 67, in wsgi
    self.callable = self.load()
  File "/home/anish/.local/lib/python3.6/site-packages/gunicorn/app/wsgiapp.py", line 49, in load
    return self.load_wsgiapp()
  File "/home/anish/.local/lib/python3.6/site-packages/gunicorn/app/wsgiapp.py", line 39, in load_wsgiapp
    return util.import_app(self.app_uri)
  File "/home/anish/.local/lib/python3.6/site-packages/gunicorn/util.py", line 358, in import_app
    mod = importlib.import_module(module)
  File "/usr/lib/python3.6/importlib/__init__.py", line 126, in import_module
    return _bootstrap._gcd_import(name[level:], package, level)
  File "<frozen importlib._bootstrap>", line 994, in _gcd_import
  File "<frozen importlib._bootstrap>", line 971, in _find_and_load

ModuleNotFoundError: No module named 'mlflow'

Running the mlflow server failed. Please see the logs above for details.
